news.title: Trump says a 25% tariff 'must be paid by Apple' on iPhones not made in the U.S.
news.summary: Shares of Apple were under pressure on Friday after Trump's post on Truth Social. Apple shares were down 0.7% on Friday morning.

news.title: Trump recommends 50% tariff on European Union starting June 1
news.summary: President Donald Trump says he is "recommending a straight 50% Tariff on the European Union" He complained that trade negotiations have stalled.

news.title: Harvard sues Trump administration over international student enrollment ban
news.summary: "Without its international students, Harvard is not Harvard," the lawsuit by the private school against the Trump administration says. The lawsuit was filed in federal court in Washington, DC.

news.title: Nuclear stocks rally on report Trump will sign executive orders to support industry
news.summary: The president is scheduled to sign orders in the Oval Office at 1 p.m. ET. The White House schedule says the signing will take place in the White House East Room.

news.title: Treasury yields stumble from highs as Trump ramps up trade war
news.summary: U.S. Treasury yields eased on Friday but remained elevated. Investors weighed the impact of President Donald Trump's tax bill on the economy.

news.title: Apple’s stock falls as Trump makes a tariff threat on iPhones. Here’s why it’s misguided.
news.summary: President Donald Trump said Apple must pay a 25% tariff if it doesn't rely on domestic production of iPhones for the U.S. market.

news.title: These bonds can stand up to any inflation spike from budget battles and tax cuts
news.summary: Heightened market volatility creates a window for TIPS. TIPS are a type of Treasury Inflation-Protected Security (TIPS) with a fixed interest rate.

news.title: Here’s why GameStop’s stock has been in play again. It’s not a meme thing this time.
news.summary: Shares of videogame retailer and original meme stock GameStop are riding the bitcoin wave. GameStop is one of the biggest videogame retailers in the world.

news.title: This hedge-fund manager has made about 50% in each of the last two years. Here’s his home run trade.
news.summary: Rob Citrone thinks the U.S. will keep its exceptionalism and the economy will boom in 2026. Rob Citrone: The U.K. will continue to be one of the most successful economies in the world in the coming years.

news.title: The ‘mother of all credit squeezes’ is coming — hang onto your wallet
news.summary: Consumer confidence is buckling, and debt is mounting. Here’s how to steer your portfolio to avoid the pitfalls of investing in real estate.
